intro: Cacalia populifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cacalia populifolia produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer.
